channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX

item.title: Report E-2025010212
item.description:
Report E-2025010212

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LEP experienced a UN2735 Niax Catalyst C-232 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 6’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damage drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and pads were then utilized to clean the impacted area. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report X-2025010763
item.description:
Report X-2025010763

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-11
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 1/10/2025 at approximately 1800, Dangerous Goods Administration received notification from Employee 5912782 at the station location in San Antonio, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing 3 bottles for retail perfume. The shipment appeared to have been damaged due to mishandling, resulting in spillage of one of the inner containers. The remaining parts of the shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits and amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report E-2025010217
item.description:
Report E-2025010217

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-24
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:59 EST on 12/24, XPO-LDA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 cup of "Liquid Berry Flavor" impacting the trailer floor from a 5gal poly pail. The pail was punctured by a forklift at LDA. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE.

item.title: Report E-2025010196
item.description:
Report E-2025010196

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-19
  • City: AMARILLO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 16:30 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal LAO. It was reported that approximately 1.5 of Koster VAP I 2000 UFS released from one 3-gallon poly drum due to improper packaging by shipper. The release impacted trailer #3178123. Terminal personnel cleaned up and containerized the spilled product before contacting the call center. Waste label 223701-1 was created, one 10-gallon poly drum containing 3-gallon, .07-gallon kit, oil dri and paper/labeling. Infotrec has been notified, report number 379945 was given by Bobby.

item.title: Report E-2025010134
item.description:
Report E-2025010134

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1225 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release of refused shipment at new terminal LHO. It was reported that residue from 250 lb Cat Battery released due to tipping over during transit. The release impacted trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used a 65-gallon poly drum for the waste.

item.title: Report E-2025010127
item.description:
Report E-2025010127

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-13
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO with LDA called to report a hazardous cargo release. It was reported 1 gallon of UN 1133 "Elevate Ultraply Bonding adhesive" from 2-1-gallon pails due to fork blade puncture. ERTS reviewed the SDS, and the caller determined terminal personnel are capable of conducting cleanup. Waste was placed in 5-gallon metal drum for terminal personnel to manage.
